repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: Closing the last non-floating window in a tabpage via
win_close_othertab (e.g., during tab closure with autocommands)
can leave only floating windows, causing crashes.

Solution: Check if closing the first window would leave only
floating windows and prevent the operation.

Fix #31236 

<!--
  Thank you for contributing to Neovim!
  If this is your first time, check out https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests-prs
  for our PR guidelines.
-->

comment_data.body:
Doesn't seem to prevent this crash:

```vim
tabnew
autocmd WinLeave * split | call nvim_win_set_config(0, {'win': 0, 'relative': 'win', 'row': 2, 'col': 2, 'width': 2, 'height': 2})
quit
```
dm has been  broken  for a long time.

> dm has been broken for a long time.

Ah, I've not checked them since the Matrix outage that also took out the dev room. I'll have a look in a bit. :+1:

> how about this like current cannot close last window, removed float_disallowed.

~~I think `win_close` is already covered by the `last_window` check.~~ Nah, that's only if it's the only tabpage. I mean `lastwin->w_floating && one_window(win)`.

Can't check `win_close_othertab` right now, but take care that there's no callsites that assume it always succeeds.

comment_regular_data.body: emm throwing an error here breaks compatibility? It crashed before.
There can be other cases where opening a floating window is perfectly fine when `split_disallowed` is set.
Ok, looks like this isn't caught by the test. How about using a new static var `float_disallowed`

Hmm, this doesn't address other cases where `win_close_othertab` can leave floats as the only windows left in a tabpage:

```vim
let w = win_getid()
tabnew
autocmd WinClosed * call nvim_open_win(0, 0, #{win: w, relative: 'win', row: 2, col: 2, width: 2, height: 2})
call nvim_win_hide(w)
```

I'm generally not a fan of adding more of these Vim-style locks if possible. Maybe instead `win_close_othertab` should bail when attempting to close the window would result in only float windows? :thinking: (though that would mean making it fallible; maybe there's a better way?)

~~If locking seems the best solution, you may have to also consider places that create floats without going through the API functions (such as `win_new_float`), as the lock currently isn't checked for those.~~ Actually, locking is inadequate as it doesn't matter when the float is opened.
Spent some time looking at this closer before bed and opened #34950 with some changes. Needs a bit of polishing at the moment, though.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(float): prevent crash in WinLeave when closing last tab
